column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The bouncy Loporrit would ask you to lend them an ear.
Speak with the bouncy Loporrit.
Choose a flower.
Speak with the bouncy Loporrit.
Just the person I was hoping to see! I'd like your thoughts on something, if you have a moment.
As you might have noticed, this park is rather drab as it is now, which is why I plan to plant flowers to liven things up a little.

Of course, there's no guarantee my tastes are in line with those of your people. We have a most wondrous assortment of plants at Lovingway's Darlings, and it would mean the moon to me if you picked which flowers we use here in the park.
Hooray! To the gardens, then! You're going to love them, I know it.

Well? What do you think? In my readings I found that even a single species of flower can bloom in a number of colors, which is what makes them so appealing. Though it took a little work, these three specimens are capable of the same.
They're all charming in their own way, but I couldn't possibly decide which is best for the park.
Which do you like best? Don't worry about giving a right or wrong answer─I trust your discerning eye!
Any of these would look wonderful in the park, but which one do you like?
Oh, this one's cute! I like how the flowers are all bunched together.
Good choice! It's so sparkly and pretty!
Oooh, I like these, too! They're sure to make an impression with park visitors.
Choose this flower?
No need to rush in choosing, though I'd be lying if I said I'm not eager to hear your favorite.
A fine choice! Now, let's take a few back to the park, shall we? Do be careful not to drop any on the way!
The flowers, if you please.

I'm told the people of Etheirys love nature, and flowers are held in particularly high regard. I realize they're not quite the same, but I sure hope these blooms make the moon feel a little more like home.
First things first─I need to plant as many of these flowers as I can! By the time I'm done, our gardens will be a place of joy and wonderment for all, you wait and see.
